bug.author: mercierc
bug.description:
Hello everyone, I just cloned the mlpack rep on my computer and I cannot build all the targets from make mlpack, especially mlpack_test and some generate_pyx. (May be it is normal) For example, here is the final error that I get during the failure of make mlpack_test : <denchmark-code>src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/build.make:277: recipe for target 'src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/async_learning_test.cpp.o' failed
make[3]: *** [src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/async_learning_test.cpp.o] Error 1 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:7610: recipe for target 'src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/all' failed make[2]: *** [src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/all] Error 2 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:7622: recipe for target 'src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/rule' failed make[1]: *** [src/mlpack/tests/CMakeFiles/mlpack_test.dir/rule] Error 2 Makefile:2112: recipe for target 'mlpack_test' failed make: *** [mlpack_test] Error 2 </denchmark-code>
I did not modify the mlpack/CMakeLists.txt and the the BUID_TEST option is still set to ON. If it can help, I don't have any problem from an installation of mlpack-3.1.1 that I made by following the webpage documentation. I did not find any answer to this problem on the web. If someone know the solution, I would be glad to read it. Thank you.

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mercierc>@mercierc</denchmark-link> , I think I know what the issue is. What version of ensmallen do you have installed?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> and thank you for aswering. I built mlpack from the git-hub rep on another computer and it works with ensmallen 2.10, downloaded during the execution of the cmake command. I will keep you informed about the version installed on the concerned computer as soon as I can acces it.

Good to hear. The concerned computer likely just needs the version of ensmallen 2.10.0 for the git master branch. I opened <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2028>#2028</denchmark-link> to update the documentation and CMake configuration about the minimum version needs.
I started again with the modifications of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> and it works well.
Great! I'll go ahead and close this issue then. üëç
